text: Furogu Shrine 風浪宮 (fuuro-gu) View from in front of Torii Gate Affiliation Shinto Deity Watatsumi The Furogu Shrine (風浪宮), is a Shinto shrine in Okawa, Fukuoka Prefecture. The Azumi people created the shrine. == Overview == The Shrine, locally known as "Ofurosan," has origins that date back over 1,800 years and is linked to Empress Jingū.https://okawa-kk.com/wp- content/uploads/2021/07/%E8%A6%B3%E5%85%89%E6%A1%88%E5%86%85%E3%83%91%E3%83%B3%E3%83%95.pdf The Furogu Shrine festival, also known as Reitaisai, is a popular event in Okawa, Fukuoka Prefecture. It's one of the three major festivals in the Chikugo region, attracting over 150,000 visitors in February.. The shrine is home to a massive Shinboku Camphor tree that is said to be 1800 years old.https://www.travisheermann.com/images/JETGuide2006.pdf The shrine houses a wooden statue of the seated Buddhist Goddess of Mercy. The current shrine was built in the 1560 == References == == Other websites == * Official website of Furogu Shrine Category:Beppyo shrines Category:Shinto shrines in Fukuoka Prefecture Category:Ken-sha
